intro: Melittacanthus divaricatus var. minor, commonly known as the lesser variegated melittacanthus, is a lesser-known species within the Melittacanthus genus. It is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology, featuring a combination of green and variegated patterns. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing nectar that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
